gfxeditor

Class Model

  • java.lang.Object
    • gfxeditor.Model
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javax.swing.ListModel

    public class Model
extends java.lang.Object
implements javax.swing.ListModel
    Contains a list of shapes and also serves as a data model for the JList used in DocumentWindow.
    See Also:
    GraphicsEvent

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Model()
      Constructs a Graphics Editor model.

        public void setSelected(Shape s)
        Sets the currently selected shape.
        Parameters:
        s - The selected Shape object, or null if everything is to be deselected

        Registers a graphics listener for this model.

      • add

        public void add(Shape s)
        Adds a shape to this model. Also fires a GraphicsEvent and a ListDataEvent to the registered views.
        Parameters:
        s - The Shape object to be added

      • finish

        public void finish(boolean useDefaults)
        Sets the current property (newly created shape) to null. May also assign default values to the current shape; deletes the newly created shape if it's invisible.
        Parameters:
        useDefaults - true if the shape should use its default values
        See Also:
        Shape.setToDefaults(), Shape.isInvisible()

      • delete

        public void delete(Shape s)
        Removes a shape from this model. The selected property is only changed if the removed shape has been selected before (which is most likely the case). Also fires a GraphicsEvent and a ListDataEvent to the registered views.
        Parameters:
        s - The Shape object to be removed

      • select

        public void select(java.awt.Point p)
        Selects the shape at the given point, or sets the selected property to null if there is no shape at this position. If shapes are overlapping, the one above the other, i.e., the newer one is selected. Also fires a GraphicsEvent to the registered views.
        Parameters:
        p - The position where the mouse button has been pressed
        See Also:
        Shape.contains(Point)

      • resize

        public void resize(java.awt.Point p)
        Resizes the current shape, so that it's no bigger than the bounding rectangle specified by its position (x|y) and the given point. Also fires a GraphicsEvent to the registered views.
        Parameters:
        p - The lower right point of the bounding rectangle
        See Also:
        Shape.setSize(int, int)

      • resizeSelected

        public void resizeSelected(java.awt.Point p)
        Resizes the selected shape, so that it's no bigger than the bounding rectangle specified by its position (x|y) and the given point. Also fires a GraphicsEvent to the registered views.
        Parameters:
        p - The lower right point of the bounding rectangle
        See Also:
        Shape.setSize(int, int)

      • move

        public void move(java.awt.Point p)
        Moves the current shape to the given point. Also fires a GraphicsEvent to the registered views.
        Parameters:
        p - The new position of the shape
        See Also:
        Shape.setPosition(Point)

      • moveSelected

        public void moveSelected(java.awt.Point p)
        Moves the selected shape to the given point. Also fires a GraphicsEvent to the registered views.
        Parameters:
        p - The new position of the shape
        See Also:
        Shape.setPosition(Point)
